title: California Legislators Consider First Adult Helmet Law In Country
teaser: Some cyclists groups worry requiring adults to wear helmets would deter cyclists.
contentencoded:
Legislators in California are expected to vote next month on a proposed law that would require adult bicycle riders to wear helmets. It would be the first adult law in the country — many states already require kids to wear helmets.

But many cyclist groups worry that requiring helmets could deter cyclists.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson speaks to California state senator Carol Liu, who introduced the bill.

Guest

  • Carol Liu, Democratic California state senator.
